intro: Hedysarum pabulare, commonly known as the meadow vetchling, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, pastures, and woodland edges. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow to reddish-purple flowers arranged in spikes. Its root system forms symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility. Hedysarum pabulare is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
